caption.p: Measures to guarantee the continuity of essential medical care for upcoming respiratory infection epidemic seasons in the context of SARS-CoV-2.

td.italic: Resumption of health care services discontinued in the first wave of the pandemic:

tr.td: Performance of complex surgeries before the winter months to increase the availability of PICU beds during critical periods
Moving forward elective hospital admissions before the beginning of the RSV and flu season

td.italic: Establish collaborations and joint care pathways with other hospitals offering different levels of care and with primary care facilities to optimise the use of resources
Promote new forms of inpatient care:

tr.td: Allocation of intermediate care resources to inpatient wards in close cooperation with paediatric intensivists and adapted to the specific characteristics of the facilities and the health care staff

td.italic: Stock and adequate amount of personal protective equipment in preparation for potential shortages due to new surges in demand

Promote the role of hospital paediatricians as coordinators for the creation of multidisciplinary teams (including other specialists and physicians in training) as needed in the event of surges in care demand
Intensification of the training curriculum of paediatricians with added emphasis on specialty care to increase their versatility
Adoption of specific measures for at-risk or medically fragile individuals (see section on the subject)
Planning a series of specific actions to carry out in case of potential crises:

tr.td: Hiring of staff to fill in potential sick leaves
Sectioning of wards by type of disease managed
Sectioning of care teams to prevent massive spread
Shift restructuring to avoid excessively long working hours
Ensuring sufficient breaks for rest and self-care
